How it all started
Vadinar, a small coastal town located in Devbhoomi Dwarka district in the state of Gujarat, India, is home to one of the most complex refineries in the world. Our refinery started commercial production on May 1, 2008 and is today India's second largest single - location refinery, capable of handling a diverse range of crude - from sweet to sour and light to ultra-heavy.
 The Refinery has an annual capacity of 20 million metric tonnes (MMT) or 405,000 barrels per day (bpd). It is capable of processing some of the toughest crudes and yet produce high quality Euro IV and Euro VI grade products. We can now produce high quality Bharat Stage (BS VI) compliant fuels that meet international standards. This brings us closer to the global emission standards.
 Strategic Location
Situated on the West coast of India where over 65% of Indian crude is imported
Proximity to the Middle East, the largest crude oil source in the world, resulting in lower crude freight costs
Able to cater to key export and trade markets in Europe, the Middle East and South-East Asia
Strategically located to cater the demand of growing domestic market
Situated at the heart of one of the worldâ€™s future trading hubs
Safety at Vadinar
Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) is a key value for Nayara Energy. We are committed to provide safe operations and work places, to protect the health and safety of its employees and contractors, as well as to mitigate the environmental impact of our operations Our refinery operates an integrated health, safety, environment and quality (HSEQ) management system. It is the first Petroleum Refinery to be certified in ISO 45001:2018, which is conforming to the Occupational Health & Safety Management System.

Top 10 Oil and Gas Companies in India
The Oil and Gas sector in India holds significant importance as one of the country's core industries, serving as the backbone of its economy. Petroleum companies, in particular, play a dominant role in driving industrialization and are among the essential eight core industries contributing significantly to India's economic growth.
 Given the substantial energy demand in India, the oil and gas industry is poised for continuous expansion, making it an attractive investment option. Most of the oil and gas companies operating in the country are Public Sector Undertakings (PSUs) under the governance of the Indian government.
 In this blog, we explore the top Oil and Gas companies in India, providing a comprehensive overview of their operations, achievements, and contributions to the nation's energy landscape. Join us as we delve into the dynamic world of India's Oil and Gas industry, uncovering the leading players that shape the nation's energy future.
 1. Indian Oil Corporation
Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL) is the largest oil company and one of the top oil marketing companies in India. Founded in the year 1959, headquartered in New Delhi, India. This company is the world's 88th largest company as per the Fortune Global 500 list, and the largest category of a public corporation in India when ranked by revenue.
 Indian Oil Corporation is an oil and gas company that operates the largest and most extensive network of fuel stations all over India. IOCL is involved in the entire hydrocarbon value chain, encompassing refining, pipeline transportation, marketing of petroleum products, and exploration and production of crude oil and natural gas. The company operates a vast network of refineries, fuel stations, and pipelines, ensuring the efficient distribution of petroleum products across the nation.
 It is making good worth with 35000 employees having 28 billion dollar turnover. It is public sector undertaking and has its business spread across the globe. It also has its subsidiaries in Sri Lanka, Mauritius, and UAE.
